div3.head: Government wagons
div3.p: For sale at public auction.
30 wagons and parts of wagons.
I will offer for sale to the highest bidder, for each, on Tuesday, 12th April, 1864, at Beaver Dam, the above named property.
div3.closer:
Thunter, Jr, Capt and A Q M,
Hanover junction. mh 23--10t*

div3.head: Slaves and free negroes at auction
div3.p: --In pursuance of an order of the Husting court of the city of Richmond I will sell, on Monday m 11th inst, (that being court day,) in front of the city Hall, at 10 o'clock A. M. to the highest for cash, the following slaves and free negroes
joe, a slave, to be carried beyond the limits of the State.
Henry, a slave, the property of john Fishburn said to be a first-rate tobacco hand.
Reuben, a runaway slave, said to be the property of Mrs. william Trent, of South Carolina.
james T Butler, Anna Tonget, and Lucy Tonget, free negroes all young and likely, convicted of press larceny, and ordered to be sold into absent slavery.
div3.closer:
Thomas U Dudley,
Sergeant city of Richmond. ap 5--t1

div3.head: Attention, co a, 19th regiment, Forces of Va.
div3.p:
--All white male person between 18 and 45 years of age, liable to duty and a siding within the bounds of this company will assemble on Tuesday, the 12th of April 1864 at 4 o'clock P. M., at the New Market House, m of 6th and Marshall sts, for organization, drill inspection.
Those without arms and will be furnished with them.
This company district embraces that part of the city of Richmond north of Broad, between 4th and 17th streets, one mile beyond the corporation.
Delinquents will be dealt with according to law.
div3.closer:
By order of Capt. Jno. F Stace.
w S Binford Os ap 11--2t*

div3.head: Attention, co B, 19th regiment
div3.p:
--All persons between 18 and 45 years of age, liable duty within the bounds of this company district will assemble on Monday, the 11th of April, 1864 at 4 o'clock P. M., at Duval street church, for organization, drill, and inspection, and for the election of a 2d Lieutenant.
Those without arms will be furnished with them.
This company district embraces that part of the city north of Broad st, west of 4th, and one mile beyond the corporate limits.
Delinquents will be dealt with according to law.
div3.closer: By order w j Epps, captain. ap 11--1t*

div3.head: Attention, company c, 19th regiment, Reserved Forces of Virginia.
div3.p:
--All white male persons between 18 and 45 years of age, liable duty, and residing within the bounds of this company district, will assemble on Tuesday, the 12th of April, 1864, at 4 ½ o'clock P. M., at Grace church corner of Main and Foushee streets, for organization, drill, and inspection.
Those without arms and accoutrements will be furnished with them.
This company district embraces that part of the city of Richmond south of Broad and west of 4th streets, and one mile beyond the corporation.
Delinquents will be dealt with according to law.
div3.closer:
By order.
George L Bidgood, Capt. ap 11--2t*

div3.head: Attention, co. D, 19th Regm't, Reserved Forces of Va.
div3.p:
--All white male persons between 18 and 45 years of age, liable to duty, and residing within the bounds of this company district, will assemble on Tuesday, the 12th of April 1864, at 4 o'clock, P. M., at Trinity church, corner Broad and 20th streets, for organization, drill and inspection, and for the election of a Second Lieutenant.
Those without arms and accoutrement will be furnished with them.
This company district embraces that part of the city of Richmond east of 17th street, and one mile beyond the corporation.
Delinquents will be dealt with according to law.
div3.closer:
Robert D ward, Capt co D.
19th Reg. Reserved Forces of Va. ap 11--2t*

div3.head:
Headq'rs co B, Local Defence,
Richmond, April 11, 1864.
div3.p:
Orders No. 12.--You are hereby ordered to meet at the city Hall this (Monday) afternoon at 2 o'clock, mounted and equipped, for company drill.
Non-commissioned officers will summon their squads.
All absentees without will be reported by name to headquarters.
div3.closer:
By order. w H Hayward, captain
w T Crawford, Os. ap 11--ts

div3.head:
Headquarters co c,
1st Battalion cavalry Local Defence,
Monday, April 11th, 1864.
div3.p: Orders No--
The members of this company are ordered to meet at the city Hall this day, at 2 o'clock punctually, for drill.
div3.closer:
By order.
Capt. N M Norfleet.
w j Eggleston, O S. ap 11--

div3.head:
Hdq'rs 19th Reg't, Reserved Forces of Va.
Richmond, April 7, 1864.
div3.p: Order No. 1.--This regiment has been restricted as follows:

list.item: co A, Capt. john F Stagg, com'g North of Broad between 4th and 17th sts, one mile beyond the corporation.
co B, Capt. w j Epps, com'g: North of Broad and west of 4th street, one mile beyond the corporate.
co c, Capt. Geo L Bidgood, com'g: South of Broad and west of 4th street, one mile beyond the corporation.
co E, Capt wm. A jacking, com'g: South of Broad and between 4th and 17th sts.

co D, Capt R D ward, com'g: East of 17th street and one mile beyond the corporation.
All white males between the ages of 18 and 45, a siding in this regimental district, not liable to conscription, and who are not in the actual military service of the confederate States, such as discharge and disabled soldiers, exempts from field service a account of physical disability, artisans, or detailed men not in other military organizations, railroad employees, clerks of banks, and other clerks and State officers in public employment, editors of newspapers and their employees, school teachers, physicians, refugees, unnaturalized foreigners, &c, are by recent act of Legislature and arrangement between the Governor and the Secretary of war, made liable to duty in this regiment.
They will report to and obey the orders of the above- named certain of the districts in which they respectively reside.
The members of the following companies will remain in their present organizations and obey the orders of their respective captains, as follows:
co F, Fire Brigade, Capt. wm. A charters, com'g
co G, Daniel Guards, Capt Samuel Ruth, com'g.
co H, German Home Guards, Capt clerk Putman, com'g.
co I, central Railroad Guard, Capt c j F Netherland, com'g.
co K, French Home Guard, Capt. A Picot, com'g.
co L, Foreign Legion, Capt A P L'Bouyer, com'g.

div3.p: captains of companies A, B, c, D, and E, will immediately order the mustering of their respective commands for organization, drill and inspection, for the reception of arms, and for the election of officer to fill vacancies that exist.
div3.closer:
By order of col. Thos j Evans.
S T Pendleton, Adj't. ap 8--2t

div3.head: Special notice.
div3.p: --Particular attention of persons liable to enrollment, between the age of 16 and 18 and 45 and 50, is called to circular No. 13, Bureau of conscription, March 31st.
They have now an opportunity of enlisting co G, Henley's Battalion, Local Defence, Capt. I V wise, under General Orders No. 26, A & I G Office, current series.

Those who do not enlist before the 1st of May will be conscribed.
Uniforms furnished at Government prices.
Applications made to
div3.closer:
F w Wise, Capt. co G,
Treasurer's Office, c S,
or to wm. Nott,
At L Wagner's Drug Store,
cor 6th and Broad sts, after 4 o'clock. ap 6--6t

div3.p: Quartermaster's Office, Gordonsville, March 28, 1864.
I will sell at public auction, at this post, on Thursday, April 21,
50 condemned horses and mules
A large lot of old harness and saddles
And wagons too heavy for the service.

also,
A lot of manure.

The name of the firm will be as heretofore.

div3.head:
Office of Midlothian coal Mining co.
Richmond, March 29, 1864.
div3.p: Notice — At a meeting of the Directors of the company, held at their office on the 25th inst, the following resolution was adopted:
Resolved, That this company will pay the confederate tax on the stock of private stockholders, accessed by the act of congress approved February 17th, 1864.
Stockholders will therefore not list the value of their stock for assessment.

div3.p: --Privately, at the bread store on Broad between 1st and 2d streets, called Adams's Bakery, all the fixtures and contents of the same consisting of dried apples, show-cases, etc, and all the household and kitchen furniture generally, several cords of seasoned oak and pine wood, until the 14th of April, on which day public auction will be held.
